They had a good selection of draft beers and they were half off - always a great thing! We tried their poutine and added the option for an egg on top. It was fine, but not the best I've had in the city. It was pretty small, and the egg was fully cooked which didn't allow for any dipping! :( However, after ordering we learned that it was also on the happy hour menu for $5 - maybe that's why it was small?  The top floor has a really nice set up with the large tables making it perfect for large groups. The rooftop makes it a really fun place to hangout when the weather is nice. On a busy weekend night you will have to wait in line to get up to the roof - sometimes it really takes forever!  I've had mixed experiences with service on both of their floors. Sometimes friendly, others not friendly at all, and most of the time somewhere in between. It's a big, busy place so I guess that's to be expected.   Overall I enjoy going to Siena for the experience of the rooftop bar in the city - but it's not my favorite place for food.

photos.caption: Photo of Sienna Mercato - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

KUDX7cRvlI1Fyf6DgWaxYg.text: Super cool rooftop bar! This was one of my favorite spots. Great location, easy to get to, popular spot -  definitely would go all the time if I could.

photos.caption: Photo of Sienna Mercato - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Rooftop

w6mvMht8FbBctdprHbBXmQ.text: One of my favorite places when visiting the Burg. Love the meatballs and atmosphere.  We have been here twice and loved it more the 2nd time!

0h5QxQhnpWmz0mvbiwr_bw.text: Looking for a place to eat on Mondays in Pittsburgh it turns out is not a simple task.   My friend and I were looking for a fun place to catch up over some good food and wine. We ended up choosing here due to its close proximity to the office and charcuterie options.   Being the rockstars we are we crushed the bottle of red we ordered. Helps it was also a great wine and we had a lot of work-nonsense to talk through.   Our order:  charcuterie  mushroom ravioli some delicious steak dish ice cream + brownie with extra ice cream

photos.caption: Photo of Sienna Mercato - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Wine = 10/10 would recommended to a friend

laQbq-bx9M3S4JW8UrftiA.text: Had dinner with girlfriends on the second floor. We shared a charcuterie board and a bunch of small plates. My friend has a horrible mushroom allergy and they were very careful about making sure she knew what was safe. Everything we tried was delicious and splitting the bill 6 ways made it super affordable! Then we went to the rooftop for a drink. We watched some playoff hockey and enjoyed a few beers. There was a good selection. I have never been to the first level so I can't speak to that but the top two were great!

yenTL9RTPQSrkU0r4-NlNg.text: The meatballs were amazing!!! They just tasted so good. Two meatballs was the perfect amount, on top of pasta. Comes out in super cute dish. I wish they had garlic bread, but the meatballs are definitely worth going there for. I definitely want to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Sienna Mercato - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Beef meatballs on parm pasta!

ayVrYo2FQTPOYAbx-TdrWA.text: We went to the bottom floor first.  We are out of towners and didn't know the meaning of different levels. Had a drink then cashed out and went to the 2nd floor to get the wood oven pizza.  We got the marghertia pizza.  It was amazing.  The basil on that pizza was sooo potent and amazing.  We were confused when we went to be seated.  We got the vibe it's very strict with reservations.  And everyone was dressed up but it's a casual atmosphere?  But that's okay no one looked at us funny.  Dinner was great, hubby got a mule and I tried 2 different red wines that were great!  They gave us 2 pieces of biscotti with the bill

photos.caption: Photo of Sienna Mercato - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

juRhVZdUAO_Im6PCZ3QzgQ.text: Came here on a Monday for happy hour, which runs 4-6pm.  They have a bunch of deals including $5 poutine, half off well drinks, and half off drafts.  Meatball sliders are also $2 all day Monday.  Of course, we had to order all of the above.  I'll start off with the poutine; you're able to choose from tots or fries and it comes with mushroom or chicken gravy.  I'm from Montreal so this isn't really a traditional poutine but it's still pretty good.  Now moving onto the sliders, we decided to get one of every meat so we can sample.  The best in my opinion was the chicken with crack sauce or the spicy pork with arrabiata sauce.  For $2, these are a must.  I would probably order 4-5 sliders for myself next time I go.  Overall, this is a great place for happy hour that won't break the bank.

-2xis6XrV1FGcUbLW9Feyg.text: This three story restaurant has so many different personalities. The first floor is more casual, and all about the meatballs. The second is a more intimate, classy restaurant feel, and the third story is a rooftop bar. So this one location has something for everyone.   Came here with a few friends before going to the Benedum for a show. We checked in on the no-wait app (highly recommend doing this as they do get pretty busy) and when we arrived, we checked in on the app and stood in a corner near the entrance. The hostess definitely saw us yet did not greet us (there were two hosts and a hostess, none of whom acknowledged us). The app said there were a few groups ahead of us but when it was our turn to be seated, somehow our names were not called. When bringing this to the attention of the hostess, she said it was our fault for not going and checking in with the host stand when we got there, but usually the app will let you know when it's your time or you'll at least get a call. This wouldn't have been a big deal but she obviously saw us when we came in and she saw us standing in the corner waiting to be seated yet never once acknowledged us or anything of the sort. So we had to wait another 15-20 minutes (had already waited about 20 at this point).  Although the initial service wasn't great, our server and the food definitely made up for it. When the hostess finally seated us, she didn't bring menus or silverware but our server quickly remedied that and was very attentive to us the entire time. The food was amazing. I got two sliders and we shared an order of the parmesan herb fries (delicious!). I love how you can customize your order from what meat you want to the cheese and sauces. Personally I like choosing sliders because you can come up with so many combinations and you get to try a lot with one meal. The meatballs are quite large with 3 being very filling so plan accordingly. I wish we had saved room for the dessert balls because they sound AMAZING so I will definitely have to come back and make sure I try those next.

photos.caption: Photo of Sienna Mercato - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

NpvN1wu2s5jD3Rcqlksf-w.text: Review for : Il Tetto  Went here on a warm Friday for happy hour. Had the peach slushy drink and it was fabulous and reasonable for $5. The space is so cool but became easily overcrowded and hard to hear. I'm not sure if the glass windows above normally open up but since they were closed I think that trapped the sound a bit   I also wish that you didn't need to reserve and table to sit/ there was more seating for those who are just there for drinks. It was difficult to get the attention of a bar tender so we were awkwardly standing behind people sitting at the bar for a good 15 minutes trying to order drinks

9OQjo2YG7nOGESmJVjmlZw.text: I feel like this is my go-to restaurant when I'm around that side of town. It's great for happy hour, family get togethers and casual date nights. I love that you can put yourself on the wait list too, because it can get super busy on the weekends.  I was so happy to hear that they were gluten free friendly, considering this was a fave spot pre-celiac diagnosis. The only meatball you can get gluten free is chicken. I'm wondering why that is though? Let me be clear, I'm appreciative, but I wonder if it's harder to do the beef meatballs gluten free for some reason? Anyway, also happy to see the fries and tots are gluten free. That's not always the case because they're fried in the same frier as glutenous items usually. I honestly don't think I've had fries since I was diagnosed, and they were delicious!   I was bummed to see Auroch's gluten free beer isn't on the menu here. I saw they were mentioned on IG as being at Mercato. I asked our server and she was like, no we don't have it, and walked away. I went to the bar to double check and they mentioned it was probably their other location, which I forgot about. So here's a plea to carry Auroch's downtown too!?  Glad this can still be a dependable option while downtown!

3nS6rGismiP3WD4NqxIXyA.text: I came to Sienna Mercato in a group of 5 around 6:30pm on a Tuesday evening, and we were seated right away. The restaurant is split into three floors, with a different type of food/drink on each floor. We stayed on the first floor (Emporio) which is all meatballs.  There was a decent selection of draft beers, so I got the Yammy Yammy (a sweet potato ale) which was really good. To eat, I ordered the Meatball Panini (2 meatballs with smoked gouda and the tomato basil cream sauce) with the vegetarian meatballs (mushroom, white bean, and cauliflower). The meatballs and the sauce were both super flavorful, but the portion was a little smaller than I was expecting. I also tried my friend's Crispy Parm Brussels Sprouts, which were amazing.   The waiter asked if we wanted extra parmesan on top of our meals, and several of my friends said yes. When they got the check, there was a 25 cent charge for the parmesan. 25 cents is obviously not a huge deal, but I thought it was weird that the waiter didn't mention it, and it didn't say anywhere on the menu that parmesan was extra.  Overall - a cool spot with yummy food.

hLbekJG_vSNZIPY5vq8bbw.text: We had a fantastic time during happy hour at Mezzo on the second floor this evening with Emily as our bartender. She had great knowledge of the food and great recommendations. Don't miss the lemon tart dessert!

3jF7WoHm8Z7Di0xtW42q3w.text: One of the best parts of a restaurant is consistency and Sienna Mercato nails it every time. I have visited Emporio (the meatball joint) and Il Tetto (the rooftop beer garden) several times and all of my experiences have been wonderful!   Emporio is a wonderful place to bring guests of all ages because the unique concept is something fun that anyone can get behind! I've tried tons of varieties of meatballs/sauces/serving styles and I've never been disappointed! Beware: the meatballs are big and your eyes may be bigger than your stomach!   Il Tetto is a great place for a night out! There's a lot of awesome beverage choices and you can't beat the atmosphere. Even on a rainy night, you can still see the burgh's tallest buildings standing tall.   Located right on Penn in the heart of the cultural District, there's nothing not to love about Sienna Mercato.

photos.caption: Photo of Sienna Mercato - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Sienna Mercato - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Sienna Mercato - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

ROdo4s20xBrDwXL8irjDAA.text: Truly an old world Italian restaurant with a great selection of comfort food dishes and a great atmosphere to boot. What struck me most about the place was the authentic feeling. It's like venturing into a restaurant, a bistro, from a by-gone era. I loved the charm - and the house made sausage was darn good as well.

pD4RMDYPF8QopEmChOasbA.text: I went to Emporio yesterday for lunch, and it was TREMENDOUS.  First, the ambiance of the place in and of itself is spectacular.  Dimly lit with artsy lighting (think bare, clear light bulbs, very industrial), dark wood walls, and cozy booths make Emporio very inviting.  There are plenty of (high, modern, metal) stools around the large bar, as well.    I didn't have a drink at lunch (I have to work, unfortunately), but there was an extensive list of beers on the chalkboard on the wall.  (also a feature I like).  The menu is divided up into appetizers, salads, soups, meatballs and sides.  You can get a "ball" on anything.  It's $2 to add a "ball" to your soup, salad, or side.  You can get $10 "saucy balls" - 4 meatballs in a sauce of your choice (and the sauce list is extensive!) and get a $4-5 side, and the meatballs and sauce will arrive graced over your side.  There are 4 different choices of meatball and 1 special every day.  The usual meatballs are beef, chicken, pork and veggie.    One thing I really liked about the menu is that it denoted which items were vegetarian and which are gluten-free.  For me, a person who avoids gluten, this proved very helpful.    I had the beef meatballs because I couldn't resist (despite the fact that they are not gluten free), with arrabiata sauce (GF) and white beans & escarole as the side to accompany the balls.  (also GF).  My one lunch partner had the same while the other started with an appetizer of arancini balls before digging into some meatballs.    The beef meatballs were rather amazing.  They were moist and perfectly cooked, and were very well-seasoned.  They were just tremendous.  The arrabiata sauce was just a little spicy, like the waitress advertised.  The beans and greens were done well, and the combination between the arrabiata-sauced meatballs and the side was a nice pairing.  I couldn't get enough of the dish, ate it all, and was pleasantly full after (it helped that I had a 10 minute walk back to my office after).  My friends were similarly pleased with their meals.  I can't wait to see what is in store for Emporio and the other floors of Sienna Mercato when they open!  I might just become a regular.  Truly fantastic.

Yt-eQjc5bKY9jkZMTERhnQ.text: This is a brilliant idea: one place, three restaurant options, three different floors. First floor serves meatballs, second floor serves pizza and pasta and third floor serves beer and drinks. Personally, my favorite is Emporio, the meatball joint. The food is good and reasonably priced, and they have the same drinks that are served on the 3rd floor. I've just about tried every meatball and every sauce here and they've all been satisfying. I usually get a couple sliders of different meat and sauce combos so I can sample as many of their offerings as possible. The fries and poutine are great and so are their salads. There's not much you can go wrong with here. As far as Mezzo, the pizza and pasta floor, it's ok. I've had way better pizza at other places in town. And for Il Tetto, the beer garden, the atmosphere is nice so it gets a crowd. However, keep in mind that the first floor has the same prices and they also have happy hour specials, which Il Tetto does not have. Overall, great concept. The meatballs will have you coming back.

X9-hP3D7G9hnT2N2oL7KHA.text: This is a great spot to take out of town friends and family and that's just what we did! We brought my in-laws and some friends here for dinner before checking out the Christmas market in Market Square. You can get away with a great meal without having to spend a lot, which I appreciate! I got the poutine with meatball on top and it was delicious.

wS10FF-ZIeqqc6MiTOND9A.text: They have both a standard and rotating menu.  The rotation is the meatball of the month with the recommended sides.  I usually try the flavor of the month as they are unexpected and always very good.  Also, try the buffalo chicken meatball appetizer.

IVn93KyyZehgf8jyRJuRDg.text: I was staying at the Courtyard across the street and stopped in for lunch.  Food came out quick and was very good!  Definitely recommended to others visiting in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Sienna Mercato - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Meatball Sub

GjhJEhEP5Q50oTLNsBIyIQ.text: This is a review for Emporio, the meatball joint on the first floor.  I have yet to try Mezzo, the Italian restaurant on the 2nd floor or their beer garden on the roof, but I do plan to. I've been to Emporio twice, and have thoroughly enjoyed the food, atmosphere, and menu.  Among other items (your apps, salads, sides) you pick your meatball, your sauce/gravy, and how you want it served.  The beer selection is good too! I'm not a big meatball person, but if you've ever enjoyed a meatball, Emporio is certainly worth visiting!

uOO_EQBSayVxI95w2BhQpA.text: Who doesn't love a meatball? How about lots of different types of meatballs? There is always a very unique ball of the month. Pepperoni fritters are a great appetizer. Lots of beer choices.

exUQmDDuu-ecXQAqqExVyg.text: Had an early mid week dinner at Mezzo. We had a very delicious pizza with some pickled tomatoes that was awesome and some octopus gnocchi that was good too. Wine list was on the smaller side but what we got was good. Server was friendly and efficient.

brfDLzztBpj1u5V743DGmg.text: Emporio is my go to place when I'm downtown now.  It seems to please everyone I'm with.  The meatballs are great.  I usually get 3 sliders.  I like variety.  The meatballs and sauces are too good to get a hoagie with only one style of meat or sauce.  They have the standard large draft beer selection and a nice wine selection.

um2_4J7RD_d1Lttv4oyjzQ.text: Like all the stuff I've had from Matt Porco's restaurants, I was really pleased with what I had tonight during my first visit to Mezzo.  Highlights: nice ambiance with high ceilings with that classy/ rustic Italian thing going on (and a big wall o' wine), nice wine-by-the glass selection in either 3- or 6-oz pours, and an appealing menu.  Aside from the wood-fired pizzas, there is a build-your-own cheese and meat charcuterie platter, several delicious-looking pastas, nice salads, and a few more traditional meat-based entrees.    My dinner date and I started with salads and split a pizza.  I had the escarole salad and he had the kale, and they were both delicious.  Mine had very tasty marinated tomatoes and a rich, creamy (but not too heavy) dressing. We had the wood-fired vegetable pizza, which was more Neapolitan-style.  The sofrito/ tomato sauce was rich and tasty.  Light on the cheese, like a lot of thinner pizzas.  We tried a few different reds and they seemed like great, mostly Italian selections (the barbera was my fave).  We were also totally drooling over all the pasta dishes that were passing us by, so I might try one of those next time (which they also offer in half-portions; a nice touch).   Overall, I think these owners have a good thing going with Italian food, and Mezzo is by far my favorite level of Sienna Mercato.

MMkwEIQwSccg20optpspRQ.text: Very good restaurant, I highly recommend this place. Pizza is the best, go to the second floor.

JFERysARpwk2LzyEhmwtQQ.text: This review is for Emporio.  I came here on a double date on a Thursday night. We arrived at 6 and the place was busy but not filled to capacity. They told us a 20-30 minute wait (which I didn't understand b/c I could clearly see 2 open tables that would have fit us) but it ended up being more like a 5-10 minute wait.  I was able to try a decent amount of menu items: Poutine: I opted for the tater tots (you can also get regular fries) topped w/ mushroom gravy (other options were chicken gravy and any of the sauces they put on their meatballs) and cheese curds. This was a decent sized portion for $7. It was pretty tasty though on the salty side. Pepperoni Fritters: Meh. I couldn't taste any pepperoni in these fritters which was super disappointing. Why are these named pepperoni fritters if there is ZERO pepperoni flavor. It tasted like fried cheese w/ a side of marinara. Fried Pickles: Yummy and huge portion but you can only eat so many pickles in one sitting :P Meatball Grinders: I got the turkey meatballs topped w/ almond pesto sauce and smoked gouda. My boyfriend got the spicy pork meatballs topped w/ creamy parmesan sauce and provolone. I thought the turkey meatballs were on the dry side and lacked flavor, and that the pork meatballs were decent but not mindblowing. There were 3 meatballs in each sandwich. The bread was bland and boring. It was a very average meatball sandwich.  My boyfriend and I also got 2 glasses of beer for him ($7.50 each) and a glass of sauvignon blanc for me ($10). Prices to be expected for a downtown restaurant.  Also, I had contemplated getting the 4 meatball option but unfortunately they don't allow mixing so you're stuck w/ 4 of the same meatballs/sauces. Sucks b/c it would be a great way to try all 4 of their meatball options. I don't think you can mix on the sandwiches either. If you want to try all 4 meatballs you would have to order 4 individual sliders which are $3.50 each.  Overall, the food was underwhelming. In all honesty, if it were closer to where I live, I may revisit...but it just isn't worth the trip to downtown Pittsburgh.

ubb5VUi9lV2b3359yv6e7A.text: I had such high hopes based on other reviews, but ultimately I was left a bit disappointed.  Perhaps it was a result of having my expectations set too high based on the feedback of others, but I was not impressed.  Atmosphere - 8/10 - very cool decor with open air front, reclaimed wood and rustic decor throughout.  I really like the vibe in here.  The only downside was that, when seated near to the sidewalk with the front windows all of the way up, the sidewalk is the de facto smoking area and I was constantly getting mouthfuls of hot and humid cigarette smoke.  Nothing SM can really do about that, but it still gets -1 point.  Service - 5/10 - agree with one of the other reviewers that the seemingly "anything goes" vibe in terms of waitstaff clothing was a bit odd.  I didn't see anything too outrageous, but it definitely classed the place down a little bit.  I'm not expecting Ceviche here, but being able to quickly identify your server vs. a patron is kind of a necessity.  I also just didn't get the warm and friendly vibe from a single person (hostess, host, server, or otherwise). Granted, they were busy, but you should never be too busy to provide great service.  Lastly, your menu has no description of what is in the meatballs or what the sauces are.  Either provide a side menu with basic descriptions or incorporate that into the server's table greeting.  Whatever you do, don't A) be annoyed when we ask questions or B) give one word answers because you're busy.  Food - 4/10 - really blown away by the 4 and 5 star reviews on this one.  My wife got the sliders and tried 3 different varieties. I got the panini with the meatball of the day.  When you base your concept around a single thing, you better be pretty good at it.  This was just average.  I want to be blown away with how good the meatballs or the sauce are, but I just wasn't.  The food wasn't very hot either, and the cheese on the entrees wasn't even melted.  It seemed they had rushed it through the broiler or oven because they were busy.  Disappointing :(  Price - 8/10 - for the location, very reasonable.    I wish I could give this a 2.5 star because it just wasn't quite a 3 for me.  If either the food or service improve only slightly I would have given it 3 stars.

wEOLzLJ54mVdmVISsKm8XA.text: Maybe I shouldn't write a review until I've been to all 3 (?) floors of Sienna Mercato, but - I recently ate at the first floor of this place, which specializes in meatballs. I don't really get the appeal, I suppose.  The place was very crowded and loud. The food is mediocre. (I could direct you to plenty of divey Pittsburgh bars with better food), and the service is just...okay.  I tried a couple versions of their meatballs as well as I believe their fried pickles. Everything is greasy, tasteless, and pretty much boring. Perhaps their other floors are better, but I would not recommend the "meatball floor." Good beer selection and probably ok for a quick bite during happy hour time, but that's about it.

iGTHlcVzmxXNGeC6tR41HQ.text: I have had some good experiences here, but after our most recent one, I don't think I will return. I was part of a wedding party that had been working with their Manager to plan post-wedding activities on the roof top. All was set weeks before their wedding. We arrived after the wedding, some of us before others and went right upstairs. When the Bride and Groom arrived with other guests, they would not let them in because the bride didn't have her ID. After some peaceful exchange about the pre-set plans and providing proof that she was in fact a medical doctor, which would require being over the age of 21, the staff became very rude. The used expletives and denied everyone entry. They then came upstairs and told us, "Just so you know, the rest of your party is not being allowed in tonight and we recommend you leave too!" We did just that. Terrible customer service.

epcwV0GothGORayLjoU3ug.text: We ate on the first floor. This was not my favorite place to eat but the food is decent. I do like the atmosphere and the rooftop bar is a cool place to grab a drink. I am going to head back and check out the second floor dining and grab another drink at that bar.

f3pUUDp0fLFyYetzY5n7xg.text: Can I please offer a few suggestions. That said, I am far from an expert.  Small snacks ordered..... chicken meatballs and fried pickles. While both were cooked well, the salt content was over the top.  You need to allow your customer to decide how much salt they want/need. That said, service was great and everyone was a great help. Side note...  the wine could have been sold at a cooler temp. If the wine is going to be second rate (and this customer did not expect different) then serve it with a slight chill. Very simple. I hope this serves as a constructive opinion rather than a scathing rant. Hope the chef listens. Thank you. B

Te7XuTW0-n99jxDDCpYSGg.text: Great new restaurant on Penn Ave that's reasonably priced. At first I thought this would be an upscale restaurant based on the name but I think they did that on purpose. It's a comfortable restaurant that's only been open for about two months. The meatballs were delicious and the menus were very original. I had the pork meatballs in a panini with Gouda and spinach almond pesto. The sauce was amazing. For a side I had the rocket salad with balsamic vinaigrette. Great atmosphere with the bar and stainless steel dining. Definitely going back again to try the other sauces. Our waiter told us they're going to have 3 floors with a rooftop area too. Great addition to the restaurant scene of downtown Pittsburgh.

photos.caption: Photo of Sienna Mercato - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pork panini with Gouda &amp; spinach almond pesto on the right. Rocket salad on the left

BPJo40naRXoT463ekzWO_A.text: Visited the newly opened Sienna Mercato for lunch.  I ate at Emporio, and had the Pork Meatballs with the Pork bolagnese sauce and it was delicious.  The pork was flavorful and had a little bit of a kick to it.  I wouldn't have minded some bread to mop up the sauce with, but unfortunately there wasn't any.    For a sit down lunch, it was very quick service and shouldn't be a problem getting in and out in a reasonable amount of time.    I would like to return for dinner as it looks like they have an extensive beer selection, and would like to try more things on the menu.

lDFxncPLxUWey59FO-z5iA.text: Pittsburgh loves their customizable menus! Here you can decide which meatballs you want depending on meat and sauce, later creating pasta, sliders, or other dishes.  Came here for my birthday and they were super accommodating for a big group.

az8WRsUQghMByV0yEEwCsQ.text: This place is the worst. We were celebrating divorces and an engagement for friends and the waitress ruined our entire evening. First, the air conditioner leaked on my newly engaged friend! Then, we moved and ordered dinner and were cut off prior to ordering drinks. My friend chipped her tooth on a meatball and was quite upset. After that, the waitress sent the bouncer over who laughingly had no explanation for asking us to leave aside from the waitress disliking us. Could this restaurant be any worse??

MlTUSoL-jCGmxRUlhwgThA.text: Meatball heaven, even for people like me (vegetarians)!  Cool ambiance and trendy atmosphere. Takeout menu is different from meatball selection, and there is a wide variety of drafts available.

photos.caption: Photo of Sienna Mercato - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Vegetarian meatballs with arriabatta sauce and penne paste
Photo of Sienna Mercato - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pork meatballs with Asian fried rice and fried egg

bnXdbsqHzMEvLthbwlOu5A.text: I have been here dozens of times and keep coming back for food and drink. Just realized I hadn't done a review yet. You will get good service whether you are in the restaurant, sitting at the bar, or on the rooftop. The meatballs are perfect for a small bite or a big hoagie. All spots at the bar on the ground floor or on the rooftop have a good view of whatever big game is playing.

photos.caption: Photo of Sienna Mercato - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Old fashioned done right

Y6q2gn1L3q0Y5j42wqozfg.text: We stayed across the street at the Courtyard and stopped in for a drink.  This place has three floors including a roof top bar... great fun.  We sat at the bar on the first floor and had one of the many beer choices on tap.  Also, order the bruschetta!!! Fantastic!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Sienna Mercato - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

P55u0Ht9JWhb4KEdN6TBEQ.text: I had a good time with a group of coworkers. The weather was very pleasant and we sat near enough to the street to enjoy the weather but not be impacted by the traffic sounds.  Everyone but me was from out of town. One of them is also a yelper and was excited to try the meatballs. I was pleasantly surprised that I could just order one meatball for 3.50.  Awesome, so I ordered two and split an order of brussel sprouts with a coworker.  I tried the vegetarian and the beef, both in marinara sauce.  The beef was great, the vegetarian not so much.  Maybe a different sauce would have helped, there are many to choose from.  As other reviewers have stated, the meatballs could be warmer.  The brussel spouts were good also. Splitting an order is a good idea because the portion is huge!  What I liked the best were the fried pickles.  I think these were the best fried pickles I've ever had.  Each of us enjoyed the pickles!!  You can imagine parking would be difficult downtown. But I have found parking right at a corner lot at Penn & 10th to be convenient. It was $12 the night I was there. As a comparison, a lot in the strip near the Heinz History center was 5$.  (The prices can fluctuate widely day by day depending the events going on, etc.) So great time especially with a group.

photos.caption: Photo of Sienna Mercato - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Table set up for 12
Photo of Sienna Mercato - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Two meatballs - beef (very good!) and vegetarian (ok) in marinara sauce, and an order of brussel sprouts also very good.
Photo of Sienna Mercato - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Whew!

40Y6i9TsKWIm8CHqwBCFjQ.text: I love this place to grab drinks after work. The rooftop bar is a great experience and they have plenty of beer and drinks to choose from. Seating is limited but there is plenty of standing room.

photos.caption: Photo of Sienna Mercato - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

YOUnqYwsQAuM6TBtmhb2Ig.text: Love this place! There's a casual meatball restaurant downstairs, a more formal charcuterie/steakhouse upstairs and a rooftop bar all in one building. Great food, awesome ambiance. Make reservations!

GlkYEZecHM_-ewum3uVbcA.text: Many of you may be wondering about the new Mezzo floor of Sienna Mercato.  The good news is that the service is excellent and the food is delicious.    They bring a lot of experience from their other restaurant.  For example, there's a wine I love on the Sienna Sulla menu that also is carried by Mezzo.  I had a wonderful Charcuterie and Cheese Board that was great for splitting for 2 or 3 people.  The Pizza is cooked in an authentic wood fired oven, and the choices are creative.    For dessert we split the Gianduja Tartufo, which was a tasty way to finish our meal.    One reason the staff was so well trained is they came from one of the other Sienna restaurants.  All in all, highly recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of Sienna Mercato - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Gianduja Tartufo -  espresso caramel, toasted hazelnut powder, scarlet orange jelly (pate de fruit)
Photo of Sienna Mercato - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

xxqsTX6g-TmfqD9ARZG6OQ.text: Walked by this place during my afternoon stroll. Wished I had yelped it prior to wondering around the area bc I would have stopped in for lunch. Returned to my room and yelped a few places and saw the menu items here. I am a lover of meatballs so I had to visit. Again, I strolled down a few streets and found this place. There were many people waiting for tables. I opted for a seat at the bar. The bartender greeted me and I asked for a Blue Moon. She recommend a local brew that was fantastic. She also helped me order my entree, which was balls in gravy over mac n cheese. It was tasty. Overall, I'm glad I visited and would return if in the area again.

photos.caption: Photo of Sienna Mercato - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Yummy!

GFIbCoZBV5y7dQ26gbXi9g.text: This is an awesome place. It seems like it's consistently busy, which seems like a feat of its own given the neighborhood.  I really like the atmosphere here, especially the outdoor seating. The beer tap is solid, and most importantly, the staff is very knowledgable and resourceful when it comes to helping you make a selection. They will also let you sample their beers.   The food was very tasty and comforting. It definitely hit the spot. I tried their special, the buffalo chicken meatball grinder. The food came out in a matter of minutes. I was impressed with the freshness of their ingredients, including their bread. The meatball itself was deliciously complex in taste and had a pleasant bit of heat.  This is a place that brings you back for more.

photos.caption: Photo of Sienna Mercato - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

XXSMXqdkC6mcM7HgYAbSvw.text: What a cool spot.  After the openings of Emporio and Il Tetto, I didn't know what to expect here - I love the meatball joint, and don't particularly care for Il Tetto.  I love love love Mezzo. I can definitely add this place to my list of places that I truly enjoy and will frequent.   We had a lovely window/garage door open seat on our first visit. We ordered the Butcher Board with cheese... And boy was it yummy.  They make the charcuterie in house (cheeses are not made in house). We then opted to split a pizza (perfect for two people).  We had the margherita but there were several others calling my name. It gives me something more to go back for.  They have a selection of great sounding pastas (more to try), a dessert list that even I (who is not a big sweets person) was interested in- we opted for the Pear Brulee. Nothing was disappointing. That also includes the wine list and the service.   We came back again and did the Chef's Table with a group, and all I can say is damn it was good. So much food! It's five courses of yummy.  Meat and cheeses, eggplant caponata, toasted bread, salad, pizzas, pasta galore, and dessert.  The assortment was fabulous.  We left with full and happy bellies!   This place is on my top five places to go for date night in Pgh already :) I highly recommend it.

photos.caption: Photo of Sienna Mercato - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Caesar salad
Photo of Sienna Mercato - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Butcher board with cheese
Photo of Sienna Mercato - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Wood-fired Margherita pizza @ Mezzo

MRlKgl3WmH-RXYmoWUCH_Q.text: My friend was just telling me about this place the day before so I had to come here. I'll get straight to the point. I got the 4-meatball deal (turkey) then put it all over macaroni & cheese with pesto. Awesome! The food was SO filling and so delicious. I was skeptical of being full, but I sure was! All for $15.00 as well. I would definitely come here again!  Now, for upstairs! Who doesn't love a good freaking rooftop?! I sure do! The roof is actually retractable so if it's cold, raining or anything else, the glass roof can close. Luckily, it was a nice night out so we were able to enjoy the roof open. Drinks were good, moderate in price, but I absolutely loved the atmosphere and I would come here often just to chill.

uV95xNPWknAqhH23wdK_Fw.text: A very cool concept.  Meatballs, meatballs and meatballs.  They offer a variety of meatballs with a variety of sauces.  I got my meatballs over mac and cheese.   Yum.   Their prices seem a little high for what you get but the vibe and service were both good.

FkUlqTgJu3MkCs-rFADJkQ.text: Looks nice, but that's about it. Confusing set up with three separate restaurants with their own individual food and drink menus. I went here with a large group after a work conference. We called a week prior and inquired about reserving the rooftop, and were told it was first come, first serve but that sitting together wouldn't be an issue. Not sure how, but our group ended up on the second level, which is again a different restaurant, and we were all at separate tables. It was very odd and defeated the purpose of coming as a group. The menu on the second floor was more appetizing than the rooftop, but the beer and wine selection was minimal. Everyone ordered pizza and I ordered the scallops off the "medium plate" section. They came out and I was surprised to see two very tiny scallops surrounded by various greens, pancetta (not "bacon"), and a sauce. The scallops were so overcooked they bounced off the bowl, which should have stopped me from trying them but it didn't. They were as salty and overcooked as they appeared, and the pancetta was chewy and not nearly crispy enough. I ended up sending them back. It seemed that everyone enjoyed the pizza, but wood fire pizza isn't that difficult to make palatable so I wasn't impressed.   Our server was nice and attentive, which I appreciated. My only complaint was that when refilling the water I noticed all of the servers touching the mouth of the water to the lip of everyone's glasses. That is unsanitary and just nasty, in my opinion.

photos.caption: Photo of Sienna Mercato - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. &#34;Medium plate&#34; scallops.

4Q5S1P0C1Zskkn_6AOKDjQ.text: While I have never actually eaten here, I love going to Il Tetto for drinks in the summer or winter. There is a glass ceiling that is closed when cold and opens up when warm! They have charming street lamps and string lights hanging as well. The crowd is normally lively and there are plenty of tables and space for standing. If you need some fresh air if the ceiling is closed, there is a little balcony you can escape to as well. Their beer and wine selection is great and their cocktails have never disappointed. I will definitely continue stopping in... and maybe one day even try some of their famous meatballs at the Emporio!

wdi-6Y-3xwg59KArw6t65Q.text: Outstanding!   What an awesome meal!  Great service, great atmosphere, outstanding food!  I ordered the Poutine for an appetizer (amazing), my friend got the matzo ball soup - he loved it...I got the chicken meat ball with cheese tortellini and pesto (to die for!) and then to top it off got the ricotta doughnuts with cream cheese icing - oh my god, they were the best doughnuts I have ever eaten!  Truly amazing.  Great local find!  Check it out- you won't regret!!!!   And by the way, I got a Moscow mule too...was great.  10 out of 10!

5jDEdf_qwFMdPCJVtwqZng.text: 2 story Italian restaurant with unique food choices and themes on each floor. I ate on the second floor and we ordered the margarita pizza, arugula salad, and beef tartar with an amazing bottle of chianti and for dessert the chocolate hazelnut marjolaine. I have no complaints about the food or the service. I am excited to come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Sienna Mercato - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chicken meatball with crack sauce slider
Photo of Sienna Mercato - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Basil pesto tortellini with beef meatball
Photo of Sienna Mercato - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

RCc3rzyqRMqHgob-iLFOGA.text: Excellent ambience and clearly a trendy popular place. A great menu and loved the Pennsylvania cheese plate and olives. The vegetatarian risotto was delicious . Vibrant atmosphere and cool decor . If you like Italian a must when in Pittsburgh . Look forward to trying the pizza next time

photos.caption: Photo of Sienna Mercato - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pennsylvania cheese plate and olives

xUFD-FBu0xixs49uj7J-eg.text: My first night in Pittsburgh found me on Penn Ave at this fine establishment. It was an interesting concept that in a way combined three restaurants into one via different floors. I dined at the meatball joint on the main floor and it was a treat indeed. I had the spicy pork meatballs which were great and I would highly recommend. The drink menu was tantalizing and is worth checking out as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Sienna Mercato - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Get some!!!
Photo of Sienna Mercato - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

RTCmoOvOMJfd_G9qnsK66g.text: I went to both the casual meatball emporio on the first floor and the more fancy restaurant on the second floor.   First floor- 1 star. probably the most disgusting meatballs I've ever had. Huge, dry, and flavorless. I got the spicy marinara sauce which tasted like watery pasta sauce and pesto cream which was just tasted like tasteless cream, no pesto flavor at all. Pretty bad.   Second floor restaurant was delicious though! I don't normally like gnocchi but this one was so soft and delicious with mushroom, basil and corn. We almost ordered a second! Pizza was piping hot and good as well. Our waiter recommended the farro salad. I was skeptical thinking how good can those grains be.. I was pleasantly surprised how bright and flavorful it was! Service was great as well! We told our waiter we were cold so they immediately turned down the ceiling fan in our area. Very thoughtful.

photos.caption: Photo of Sienna Mercato - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Farro salad and the gnocchi!
Photo of Sienna Mercato - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Gnocchi. So delicious I&#39;m ordering two of them next time!

3RSngmkgYiTyUxxXP4NBRA.text: PRO Atmosphere  Service  The small plates (apps) are freakin amazing  - the gnocchi is handmade and soft like pillows - the sausage is also hand made and so rich w flavor -arugula salad- what nut like topping do they use - wow  - pepperoni sausage pizza - alight spiciness, crisp crust  This place should be 6 stars  CON:  Small table??? Hard to fit everything

qoO-hKYSQO_ebZtrNKbmIg.text: Went here last Friday with my kids. Nice atmosphere in the heart of the Cultural District in Pittsburgh. Sat by the open window in the front and enjoyed the energy and people walking by.  Food was excellent. Had fried ravioli and bruschetta for appetizers. The ravioli was good and the sauce very good so knew the main course was going to be good already. The bruschetta was exceptional, the kids commented (20 and 22) on how much they enjoyed it.  The main course meatballs, of course were tasty. Good bread on the panini and hoagie. French fries were baked and not bad at all.  Service was terrible. Only saw the waiter 3 times. When he came at the end of the meal we asked for for to go containers since each of us had a considerable amount of delicious food (very large portions) we wanted to take home. He came back and said I grabbed a couple and dropped of the check. Well, a couple was 2 large containers and one small container. We couldn't fit all our food into it. When he came back pointed out to him that we had asked for four containers and he hadn't done that and he should pay more attention to what he was doing. He brought back 2 more and I gave him my credit card. When he brought it back he just dropped it on front of my son's girlfriend who was sitting to my left. I said give it to me not her. He picked it up and threw it in front of me and said "you need to be more respectful" I demanded to see the manager and he walked away. I told the manager what happened and while he said he would deal with it I doubt very much whether he did.  So, waiter worked for free. Had he been not a jerk he would have made 25 bucks had he been nice and checked on us he would have made 20.  I won't go back. I work too hard for my money to spend it on a place with rude lazy wait staff

fEO0_3PE1Kwus0zYLWjH2g.text: I can't even remember how many times I have eaten here! Perfect lunch spot in the city. Meatball Monday's are a favorite for downtown, $2 sliders all day! Always numerous craft beers on tap that they rotate. If I didn't have to go back to work, I could have had tried a new one today.  Salads are good too, especially with an added meatball....and don't forget the tots!! Come hungry

photos.caption: Photo of Sienna Mercato - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Beef slider with creamy pesto sauce

nHD44QeQJeDSTw7fZ7sy1g.text: A surprisingly good spot for vegetarians! We went for a Friday lunch and it was quite crowded and lively. The first floor is the restaurant and the upper floor is I believe a bar/rooftop patio. Sadly it was closed that day but I've heard excellent things! You can only order food on the first floor, but can order drinks throughout the restaurant.  The menu is all meatball-based but extremely customizable. You can choose number, bowl or sandwich, type of meatball, and sauce. I got a veggie meatball slider with buffalo ranch which was quite good! I can't wait to come back when I'm hungrier to try all of the combos-some of the sauces look out of this world

photos.caption: Photo of Sienna Mercato - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Veggie slider with buffalo ranch

4thHI9_2I7CIoy2AQylqcA.text: Loved the meatballs! Had the pork meatball & spicy chicken meatball bowl over the roasted Brussel sprouts with creamy parmesan sauce. It was amazing! The bartender was very knowledgeable of the menu and gave great recommendations. This place is a must try! Can't wait to go back

photos.caption: Photo of Sienna Mercato - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pork meatball &amp; spicy chicken meatball over roasted Brussel sprouts topped with creamy parmesan sauce

4H46PFpe3OWI7r1tfJMa3g.text: I enjoyed Sienna Mercato.  I like the idea of showing up to one building and then picking what you want to do.  You want to eat, sure.  You want to drink, sure.  You want to mingle, sure.  You want to hand out on a rooftop bar and take in the city, sure.  This place is always busy no matter what time of the day.  I have walked by this place on numerous occasions and thought to myself maybe next time.  Not because I didn't want to come in, but because there were so many people that I thought maybe next time I'll think ahead and come prepared.    If you do come here, make sure that you make plans ahead of time because if you have a plan, you'll know what you are in for.  I showed up here for a little farewell party and knowing where to go when I got here made it a bit easier.

MQQK707fmbUZwF6aGVc4Jw.text: My mother-in-law put a lot of pressure on herself to make our rehearsal dinner perfect. While I envisioned something smaller, she wanted to do something special for her only son and his soon-to-be wife on their wedding weekend. So she chose the rooftop at Sienna Mercato.  To start, we walked in at 3 PM and to our surprise, the rooftop was open to the public, even after we were told via email the rooftop would be opened for us only to rehearse from 3-4 PM.  Our section was not roped off as promised, there were no selective drink menus that we discussed previously, no alcohol wrist bands for our guests, our slide show (which took a lot of time scanning photos and memories onto the computer) was never displayed on the screens as promised, and we were supposed to have 4 - 5 servers dedicated to our event as well, and the only time we even saw ONE was when we completely ran out of something.    I had a cake delivered to the restaurant, and when it came time to cut it, I had to do it myself... the pastry chef was "gone," but nevertheless, I'm not sure why the servers or event manager weren't capable of cutting the cake?  They handed me a massive knife (not meant for cake cutting), stood there, and watched me cut the it the whole time.  The knife was so enormous, they literally had to stand there and "guard" it when I wasn't using it.  If something like using the knife is such a huge liability that it needs a "guard," a staff member should be the one cutting the cake - not someone who is paying to host the event. The real cherry on top was the fact that Sienna Mercato lost our custom $200 cookies we had ordered... even though they a) were delivered with the cake and b) we were assured via email that they would go where they needed to go.   On top of all of this... they charged a 22% gratuity (totaling $1,100). I understand that 22-24% is standard in catering and events, but the fact that SO many mistakes were made on an event that my mother-in-law spent over $6,000 on and 22% was STILL added to an incorrect bill is laughable.   Their solution?  Refund my mother-in-law $800 (which doesn't even cover  the incorrect gratuity she paid) and refund me $200 for the missing cookies.  The only exception to the poor service was one of the bartenders, Andrea, who went above and beyond to try to give us an amazing experience.

HTMPT_lOJieEo501v-nTBA.text: 4.5 stars.  I dined at the mezzo level during restaurant week, and was in for a treat.  Where most restaurant week menus were pretty fixed, Sienna Mercato was like, nah, allow yourself to indulge in whatever you want.   To start, I had the fried eggplant and cured beef. The salad in both dishes were a bit on the oily side, but at least the salad tasted good.   Then, for the medium dishes I had a slow roasted pork belly and the mussels. For the price, the mussels are an absolute steal because you get so many of them. The slow roasted pork belly was also really fun. You don't get much, but it's definitely a delicious piece to enjoy.  For the mains, my favorite had to be the shrimp pasta. The sauce is at the perfect spiciness to give a tingle, but not overwhelm you. I enjoyed the fresh pasta and the shrimp of course. The other mains were alright---the pork chop I would've preferred to be cooked closer to medium, the farm chicken was on the dry side, and the seafood pasta was nice but nothing super outstanding.  By the time I got to dessert, I was absolutely stuffed, but hey, always room for more dessert. I found the apple dessert to be the star here. The warm apple slices were super comforting at the end of a fabulous meal.  Overall, the plating for all the dishes were very well put together. They had enough pizzazz to wow you, but didn't excessively put useless ingredients since everything was still edible, and could play some role in the flavor combination.   Enjoyed my experience and would highly recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Sienna Mercato - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fried eggplant
Photo of Sienna Mercato - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Cured beef slices
Photo of Sienna Mercato - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Slow roasted pork belly

rk_P4eSayidusTW2m0Eklg.text: Really good food.  First you decide if you want a bowl, hoagie, panini, or a slider.  Then you choose a type of meatball - Chicken, beef, spicy pork.  Then you chose any veggies (costs extra), lastly you pick a sauce.  I chose a spicy pork panini with a  buffalo sauce. Excellent meal.  Good spice.  Fun downtown atmosphere too.  Reasonable pricing too.

photos.caption: Photo of Sienna Mercato - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sienna Mercato

lAmKSeK4knsRNzA8U8jJmg.text: It has 3 different dining options, I went to the middle one which is Mezzo. My girlfriends and I loved it. Food was amazing. Each bite was full of wonderful flavor. I got the Potato Gnocchi. Oh my heavens it was delightful. Also we all shared the Charcuterie Board. It was out of this world. Can't wait to go back and sit on the rooftop which is IL Tetto level.

photos.caption: Photo of Sienna Mercato - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Potato gnocchi
Photo of Sienna Mercato - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Charcuterie Butcher&#39;s Board

Q-tIb-DLlIJy2cAyKP7IKQ.text: Went there a few days ago while on business I understand there was a heatwave but NO air conditioning just ceiling fans  While waiting for our table ( 6 of us) we were dying from the heat, so to Cool off of course we ordered drinks at the little bar We couldn't get anyone to serve us when we finally did we waited and waited and we actually were seated before getting the drinks Obviously still hot as .... I have to say food was small and severely overpriced Would never go back....sorry

l9igTDMZREZPzo6P_nguqg.text: Sienna Mercato is the go to bar for nice evenings. I always send friends from out of town here!  I love the rooftop bar, you can't beat the view. However, that's about all I love about this place. The food selection on the rooftop bar is minimal, mostly bar food - like Jerky, and small snacks (not burgers, or anything like that) I wish that the restaurant allowed food from the other 2 floors to be brought upstairs.   I'm a wine drinker, for $10 you get a tiny mediocre wine, but that's an expected price for downtown! They have mixed drinks, and a pretty nice beer selection as well.   This place is surrounded by great restaurants, so I would even suggest stopping here to finish off the evening. One of my favorite downtown spots for a nice view of the city!

SIp0KjwaL92XIkvQYfLftg.text: This review is for Emporio. I came here for dinner with a friend tonight. It wasn't busy and we were able to be seated right away. We ordered the fried ravioli and the bruschetta for appetizers. I ordered the matza ball soup, which comes with your choice of a meatball. I went with the chicken meatball. The meatball comes in the soup. To me, the chicken meatball was the star of the show. It had such good flavor. Overall the matza ball soup was really good too. It had pieces of chicken in it, along with the matza balls and veggies. I also got a side Cesar salad which was supposed to have croutons, shaved parm and romaine. It didn't have any croutons on it, but it was still a good salad overall. I ordered a chicken panini with smoked Gouda and crack sauce on the side. I also got him a side of fries too. The sides are $6/piece, but you get a large amount, and it's definitely enough to share with 2-3 people. I tried the panini and it did not disappoint either.  The only reason why I gave it 4 stars is because our waiter was a little pushy and it seemed like he was trying to rush us along. I didn't really like that. But overall, I would definitely come back here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Sienna Mercato - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Matza ball soup with a chicken meatball

Akli3kz9cFeAzPtmydbjMg.text: Sienna Mercato is a three story restaurant offering a different dining experience in each floor.  First I think the architecture of the building is great; tons of wood and exposed brick make it a modern and inviting environment.  Emporio is in the first floor and specializes in meatballs, pastas and has an excellent beer list.  It's also the most casual.  Happy hour at Emporio is very good with beer discounts and food.    Mezzo is in the second floor and is a little more upscale.  It features excellent wood fired pizzas, appetizers and charcuterie.  I think the food is very good and the service is also good.  The cocktail menu is well done and the bartenders know what they are doing.  I've come here with friends several times and always have an enjoyable evening.  It would also be a good location for a date.  Mezzo can get busy so I would recommend planning in advance and having a reservation.   Il Tetto is on the third story and is the roof top bar with a great view of the city above. It is accessed from the elevator in the back of the first floor.  Depending on the night it can be busy and will have to wait to go up.  In the summer the glass ceiling is open providing lots of fresh air.  In the winter the space is heated and comfortable.  Usually I stop here before going to a game or event in the city for a drink and you can order appetizers.  There are also long high top tables so you can meet friends and gather around.     I have always had very good experiences at Sienna Mercato.  The prices can get a little high but I don't find it outrageous for the quality.  Plan ahead and enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Sienna Mercato - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chefs Board

5fHxRRtOi9yvzAgd_RZrEg.text: I have been here maybe 20 plus times. I have been here with friends and family.  The rooftop bar is open during the summer months. The bottom part is where the food and drinks are available.  The food is off the top great!! Overall my favorite place to eat and recommend to anyone.

yg0wIzSEas6oRvL5RuJjoQ.text: I had always heard good reviews from Emporio's meatball joint so I decided to try out the vegetarian meatball with some friends. Unfortunately I can't say I was too impressed with my meal. The veggie meatballs had a weird, mushy consistency to them and they were served on a literal log of bread.   I appreciate that Emporio was accommodating for vegetarian and gluten-free needs but I wasn't overly enthusiastic about the vegetarian meatballs.

photos.caption: Photo of Sienna Mercato - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Vegetarian Meatball Grinder

eq6pjZFtc8x0Jsyt0zURaA.text: It's been a minute since Sienna Mercato opened, which brings two things to mind: 1) time for a review! and 2) Sienna Mercato's been open THAT long?  Now that I'm done reeling from yet another realization that I, too, am getting older, it's time for an updated tell-all about the balls...  Meatballs, you weirdos.  I was here for dinner last week and our group indulged in the buffalo chicken meatballs and cheesy bread appetizers.  Both were tasty and shared easily among our table of 6.  I found the buffalo chicken meatballs to be just spicy enough, and I loved the shaved celery/blue cheese combo that topped the whole dish.  While perusing the menu for my dinner selection, I couldn't take my eyes off the Angry Birds bowl: two chicken meatballs, crack sauce, and crumbled bleu cheese atop government mac and cheese.  Sign. Me. Up!  I ate a little over half my meal and still felt comfortable enough to walk out of the restaurant under my own volition.  Bonus: the leftovers made for some quality snacking the next day.    The one word I kept using to describe my feelings after the meal was "content."  It was such a yummy, comforting bowl of food and I absolutely plan to order it again soon.    Quality comfort food and the option to take in the rooftop atmosphere of Il Tetto after your meal are great reasons to come here on your own or bring visitors for a taste of 'tahn.

HLXEjBhQ9NpquCphYNg0YA.text: So this place is really two restaurants, maybe even three if you count the rooftop. I've eaten at both the Mezzo, on the middle level, and Emporio, on the bottom level. If I have to recommend either, it would probably be the bottom level and you gotta get those balls.  Mezzo was kinda upscale with plenty of pasta and pizza choices. I ended up Shrimp Fra Diavolo and my boss the Duck Speck pizza. Both were well executed, but nothing to write home about.  Emporio is a different story altogether. The atmosphere is much more laid back and it feel more like a pub than anything else. Showing up on a Monday turned out to be a good idea, since they serve meatball sliders for $2 each. I got the following: beef with tomato basil cream, pork with government cheese, and chicken with crack sauce. All were absolutely delicious, especially the pork which I was a bit skeptical about when the waitress suggested it. Serious good eat for cheap? What's not to love?

photos.caption: Photo of Sienna Mercato - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

1XUSR9yKNNsh5lsVCrcMjA.text: Decent drinks and decent food.  Had the pizza which was ok.  Went to the bar on the third floor and had a couple of beers and appetizers the appetizers were really good.  Great value during happy hour

RqUtfM7K0Qc91dOgaW_WPA.text: Cool atmosphere, but thats about it.  The wedding soup was cold and bland and the meatballs I had were dried out and without much flavor.  I'll give it another try when the upstairs opens, but for now I'll pass.

2IrQs1F9J9Hmk_vLTWDZSw.text: Sienna Mercato has a great Italian restaurant in the second floor. I recommend sharing a pizza for two. Portions are very generous. The local cheese plate is very good also. One drawback: noisy environment as the restaurant gets crowdy.

WjANc4KwuztXUkl6va3cSQ.text: Ate at the emporio portion with my daughter on take your child to work day. Loved the bowls we ate. Definitely will come back.

eT5lpToKJPY7qvbo77evQw.text: Mezzo: Awesome pizza with unique flavors. Good to share for 2 or 3.  IL Tetto: Great rooftop atmosphere with amazing views, service, and drinks.

e1fW1fwlIaRpHDgaGFlcAA.text: I've eaten at Emporio Meatball Joint, the first floor restaurant of Sienna Mercato, several times before writing this review and the consistency of the high quality food and outstanding service is beyond impressive. After many meals with lots of different people in groups ranging between four and 14, the food always rocks and the service is always flawless.  The menu is has some great starters. My favorites include the crab balls, Buffalo chicken balls and the rocket salad. The entrees are all meatballs, which seems improbable, but with the three step fun process  -- pick your ball, pick your sauce and pick your preparation (and perhaps a side), the possibilities are endless and it never gets old. I'm a fan of keeping it simple with the saucy balls. Servers can often suggest some winning combinations with particular sauces and sides. There's an extensive craft beer selection that's heavy on local brews, some good cocktails and an adequate selection of wines.  Service is always on-point. I have to give the restaurant props for the ease with which they handle large tables. On at least two occasions I've had over a dozen people at a single table. Not only does the staff nail it by getting orders correct and having courses arrive at once, but upon request they cheerfully provide separate checks (yes, even for 12 persons!) and they make it look easy. I can think of a lot of restaurants that could learn a thing or two from the customer service that Emporio provides.  The atmosphere is fun and lively with a good soundtrack. Big windows at the front open to the sidewalk when the weather is nice. There are high-top tables in the bar available too.  There's no reservations,but it's a sizeable place and tables are always turning over. Plus, they use the No Wait smartphone app very effectively and the bar area is an inviting place to wait, as is Il Tetto, the third floor rooftop bar worthy of its own praise (as is Mezzo, the second floor restaurant).  For those unfamiliar with downtown Pittsburgh, it's worth nothing that the restaurant is very close to the convention center, Westin Hotel and Courtyard by Marriott and is only a few blocks from the theaters of the cultural district and the bridges that lead to PNC Park and the Warhol Museum.

4HiuznfY0dPhquLHAWO5bA.text: Went in for drinks after my wife's work holiday party on a Friday in early January.  For every member of the wait- and bar-staff there were 3 "bouncers"(?) wearing ear pieces and standing around watching over the beer hall style bar on the top level.  This got to be especially frustrating when you could not get the time of day from the serving staff to order drinks.    I can't speak to the food and dining experience, but I can say they don't have it together as a watering hole.

YnYriDLXrA1UbVXjPy5ixg.text: Went here today for lunch with 6 others including 2 children. We started with the pepperoni fritters which were okay.  Several people at the table ordered salads and they were a nice size and the home made dressing was excellent.  I had 2  beef meatball sliders, one with marinara and one with creamy parmesean sauce. Both were good, but could have used a bit more sauce. The mac and cheese with government cheese was a hit with the adults and kids. Everyone enjoyed their meal, and the service was great.  I would definitely recommend this for lunch or if you have no kids...happy hour/night out as they have a large draft selection.

OjzxRLjRWYZ_QKCOg4VJhw.text: Started with the pepperoni fritters because, what the hell is that? Basically the best appetizer ever. The main course was just as good. Reasonably priced, interesting layout, and service was prompt. Highly recommend

nP2_39SZf25490mSyx-nog.text: This restaurant is a very good place with great atmosphere.  We sat on the meatball floor.  The whole concept of 3 different floors with 3 different experiences is a very intuitive idea.  I had the pork meatballs with pork bolognese or pasta and my girlfriend had the vegetarian meatballs with a side of quinoa.  Both of these entrees were a pleasure to eat.  They were very tasty and seasoned well.  The pork meatballs were tender and juicy, not dry.  The vegetarian meatballs had great spices in them.  They also have a nice beer selection.  I will most likely be returning here to try one of the other floors in the restaurant!

p90j69ejpFr-vHPPnClEOg.text: I ate at Emporio a couple of times before seeing shows in the Cultural District and it's usually pretty quick, so a good option if you're pressed for time.  I had the turkey meatballs and pesto, both delicious. The herb fries are really good and one order is more than enough to split with someone else. I'd recommend this place.

M0eamHkKO9bW8g1nyS-_MA.text: Based on our personal experience, here are a few tips on how NOT to get verbally abused at Sienna Mercato:  - DO NOT USE MORE CHAIRS THAN THAT ALLOTED TO YOUR PARTY o You may unapologetically be berated just loud and dramatic enough for everyone to stare at you in horror (GM, Chris Clark, was kind enough to put on this performance for our party) - DO NOT STEP MORE THAN 2 IN. AWAY FROM WALL WHILST IN LINE FOR ELEVATOR o You may be physically pushed (female, or not) if you step out of line o Member of staff may not hesitate to demean and degrade you with terribly inappropriate language (Jarvis... here's to you.)  If you're still interested, try the tater tots. They're actually pretty good. But don't even bother getting a drink upstairs... if you haven't noticed yet. The service sucks.

nSrJhyvoO7ZlEryGMfGkUQ.text: When the meatball joint opened, it was amazing!  Reasonably priced food, great service and good portion size.  The last time I was there, the prices had gone up, the food portion went down and the service was terrible.  The new menu charges you separately for every bit of food you can add to your plate. I e-mailed the restaurant with our service issue and no response.  Can't say I'll be going back.

NzgiGbt8Tx7oaGeoCHyXbQ.text: Emporio (first floor) is amazing!! Joanna is the greatest server and Troy a most-excellent manager! We celebrated our anniversary downtown and dined here in the evening. We love the chill environment and fun menu. Everything we ordered was incredible. We will definitely be back...and can hardly wait for the location in Wexford to open!

x1EIuZ8KLy1Eg6QtdY_H_w.text: We did the Emporio Meatball joint.  Menu confusing as heck, too much of a schpiel required by the waitress.  Wanted to get just a plain meatball with Marinara, unable to order that, she said, unless I ordered the meatball slider at a dollar extra beyond the addition of a meatball to the soup.  Poutine would have been great, but the cheese curds just completely slid off the frites.  Frites were really delicious though.  Spaghetti that we ordered with the Marinara sauce and meatballs was just okay, but meatballs clearly the star here.  Dining partner said this tin serving dish his meatballs and spaghetti arrived in was awkward to eat from, would have preferred a regular porcelain bowl.  Chicken pieces in the wedding soup were almost brittle and old-tasting, could have left that out and just added the meatball, which I ended up doing.  Good place if you're heavily into meatballs.

87M-wO4EbFGn6g53owpwYw.text: I have been here about half a dozen times.  I like to bring out-of-towners here.  The rooftop bar is great and has a lovely view of the city.  The meatballs are a fun concept.  One of my go-to restaurants.

RLbWoIri29BcQ8yjzsvQLQ.text: This place epitomizes the rumored transformation that is in the process of taking place in Pittsburgh. Great food, drinks, and service, but the atmosphere is second to none. Definitely a must visit for locals and visitors alike! You will not feel like you're in "Pittsburgh".

VFyX0E_dlGVtk5MqjtW25w.text: Calzones are huge even a small!! Great place to grab a slice or are just in the mood for some food! Close to the hotel we were staying.

pM-et3_dA6NO7hk_aSBfCg.text: We went to mezza at sienna mercato. We had an Italian cheese plate and the sausage and peppers pizza. Everything exceeded our expectations including the delicious rose on a warm day. We then proceeded upstairs to the beer garden. My disappointment came that they don't have the same drink menu and it was very loud. I had to drink a different wine (not a single rose available) and we couldn't hear each other speak. Not horrible, but my only complaint! If we would have just eaten dinner and left, it would have been perfect!

wWM126s4cDId7w46UJ3hbA.text: Sienna Mercata has been on my short list of places to try for some time when visiting Pittsburgh for work travel.  I stayed at the Westin on this particular visit and the restaurant was within a short walking distance, so I took full advantage!   I dined on the first floor at Emporio.  I normally frequent restaurants that use Open Table, because I hate to wait.  This restaurant was not on Open Table, but does use a Call Ahead process, and corresponding Mobile App, which was pretty cool!   I arrived based on notification from the app, and was seated immediately.  I had previewed the menu, and pretty much knew what I wanted to order.  I ordered a salad to start.  The salad was simple but tasty.  I then ordered the beef meatballs with mushroom gravy with a side of veggie Quinoa.  My entree arrive a short time later.  I love mushrooms, so I was kinda expecting actual mushrooms in the gravy, there were none.  Also, I expected the quinoa to arrive warm, it was cold dish, which was not indicated on the menu.  The meatballs were excellent, great texture and flavor.  The gravy was tasty as well, even without actual mushrooms.  The quinoa was good, but really contrasted with the warm meatballs. I couldn't eat them together, so I ended up eating the meatballs and leaving most of the quinoa.  Next time, I'll opt for a warm carb to accompany the meatballs.  I finished the meal with warm ricotta donuts.   The donuts were warm, rich and tasty.  I also requested a side of fudge sauce for dippings.....yum!   I can't wait to return.

cCygxfZqyAgnThD4gQLdxA.text: I was intrigued when my co-workers told me about this place:  the "meatball" restaurant.  I was not disappointed!  I was a bit boring and just got spaghetti and beef meatballs but it was delicious.  Next time I go, I am going to take the route if some of my co-workers and order sliders with different types of meatballs.  I definitely recommend this place

Jwb2-yzZYmxA38gAdohTew.text: I loved the overall ambience and intimacy of this place, inside it has a rustic industrial feel  to it. Today the front part was open which was nice to soak in downtown.  I opted for Italian wedding soup with a wedge salad but no meatball I figured there would be some in my soup but it was a chicken only base.  My wedge salad was very fulfilling with the heat bacon and out of this world randy dressing. Definitely try the ranch.  Today I dined on the first floor but the rooftop beer garden is stunning especially at night time the city view is breathtaking.

UZf-B-c2W0cAYxDZhov1Sw.text: I give this restaurant maybe a 2.5 stars. We went on a Wednesday night around 10pm and there was a nice amount of people in there. We sat in a booth in the bar area on the main level which is the Emporio. This is the meatball joint. The pasta level was already closed... So we ordered meatballs with spaghetti and some with penne. My husband ordered risotto and did not care for it. To me the flavor and color reminded me of Spaghettio's. They have different styles of meatballs and we had the special, which consisted of pork, rolled with pieces of pepperoni and parm cheese and the second style was spicy pork. I liked the spicy pork better. The noodles are gluten free and we didn't care for the texture or taste. Our waitress was kind but she didn't check on us often. We had to ask a different waitress for almost everything we needed. They also give a carafe with water, but do not ask if you want ice or even a straw. After I asked for that she brought a larger glass with water but never provided refills. So I kept refilling my glass from the carafe, but by the end of our meal the ice was melted from the room temp water! Overall it was a mediocre experience including the food. We will not return.

photos.caption: Photo of Sienna Mercato - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Carafe with water. Cute, but I prefer ice and a straw!

bE-RunU6kpfnB8TvOAWQfg.text: Can a vegetarian enjoy a joint that specializes in meatballs? The answer is yes. The restaurant provides a vegetarian largely bean based meatball and plenty of vegetarian friendly sauces to go with it that are marked as vegetarian so you can be clear. You can get it in a traditional sandwich type way or have it with their extensive sides such as mac and cheese, penne, risotto, or a quinoa. I had mine with the pesto almond sauce and Gouda cheese. Very delicious. The parmesan fries are really delicious as well served with an awesome aioli dip.   Sierra Mercato is three levels technically. The top floor is a rooftop bar type setting filled with unwinding young professionals for the most part. It is quite nice, but does not have the same menu as downstairs. The wait time is usually pretty long. My recommendation is to have a drink on the rooftop from the bar and use the Nowait App to get a seat downstairs and enjoy their delicious food that is not available upstairs. They do have small plates upstairs though. 2nd floor bar/restaurant is not open yet. Oh and PS, the prices are pretty reasonable considering the cultural district location and "nice" ambiance.

eT9WRVMAZcOHLHcnTyru6w.text: I haven't been here since sometime last summer and I was excited when a co-worker suggested that a group of us should do lunch at "that meatball place" today. When we got there we started to discuss "plan B" after we requested seating for six. The hostess said that the biggest booth that she had available could only seat five. After a bit of discussion we decided that we'll make it work somehow. The hostess took us to a round booth in the corner and it easily fit all six of us. The seating area where we were seemed to be on the darkish side but the booth was comfortable and we sat there for about five minutes before a waitress came over and asked if we'd like to get started with drinks.  I asked if we could see menus and the waitress seemed a little annoyed... not annoyed at us, but more on the order that the hostess who seated us should have already brought us menus. Perhaps this has happened before but she was kind enough to get them for us.  I think it's kind of interesting how the menu is laid out when it comes to ordering meatballs. You first pick what type of meatball you want, classic beef, spicy pork, vegetarian or turkey; then you choose a sauce; finally you decide how you want your meatballs served be it on sliders, a panini, a grinder or in a bowl. We all ordered something different; I ordered the spicy pork with Bolognese in a bowl. It didn't take very long for our individual meals to come out.  Everyone seemed to enjoy their meal and my spicy pork meatballs were yummy. They were a little smaller than a tennis ball and generously covered in rich Bolognese sauce.  Other than the hostess being a bit "off her game" today, I give Emporio a thumbs up.  I don't think that it's one of those places that you order the same thing each time you go. There's so many combinations of meatball choices to choose from.

photos.caption: Photo of Sienna Mercato - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Spicy Pork Meatballs with Bolognese Sauce

2p7Kmg5JTNwZ5X5o44y9RQ.text: A trendy and popular restaurant in downtown. The hosts struggled at the beginning - skipping us and giving tables to a party after us - but more than made up for it by treating us to a round of drinks. Thank you, Manager!  Food was excellent, especially the pork risotto. However, the margherita pizza needed  much less tomato sauce and much more mozzarella.  I recommend, especially if hanging around downtown and want quality drinks with quality and rich food.

OL-fZlFoJ8BJtxuEorzchg.text: Stopped in with several business colleagues for lunch. The place was packed, but thankfully we had made reservations and were quickly attended to.   The place is really just a meatball joint that offers a variety of meats to choose from and then some really good appetizers/finger foods, fries, and salads. The portion sizes are more than adequate, too...and the prices are pretty reasonable for downtown eating.   Not to forget, the place does have a great "feel" to it with the open-wall style seating so you can watch the passers-by.  I'd definitely be interested to try the rooftop bar on a great weather night.   3.5 stars, but giving it a little bump to 4 since it's above 3 stars, for sure.  Looking forward to my next time back...cheers!

CLjz5ZkWhZ4hMZW_XcGfsg.text: At this point I have been to all three levels of Sienna Mercato on multiple occasions.  My favorite by far has been Emporio.  The beer garden is nice in the summer but it really suffers from a crap view and they tend to be short on staff.  Mezzo has good food, but the atmosphere is just not as fun.  Emporio has the fun, the beer selection, and delicious food.  I cannot comment much on the menu because I never make it past the special or the ball of the month.  They've never let me down.  Pro tip: their tater tots are a on the salty side, not too much, but a bit.  Also, feel free to have fun with the innuendos, everyone else does.

dNKwTZInUYlCXT0tlnhYzw.text: Amazing atmosphere, especially during the warmer months! The rooftop deck is beautiful and provides a very different view of the city skyline. Very big and seasonally-changing drink menu provides many different options. Variety of different foods to choose from, but you really can't go wrong with a classic margherita pizza. They also have a tiki lounge on the roof every Sunday, with tons of different tropical, fun drinks. Will definitely be back, again and again!

y5QeR4Gl3GKU_QOAbif1Zw.text: Review for Emporio:  The wife, toddler and I went for lunch. We live very close to downtown and we're used to the parking situation but trying to find parking on the street where the restaurant is located can be a challenge to say the least. The hostess seemed pretty freaked out that we had a little kid with us, but the wait staff was professional and helpful.
